name: One Incredible Tale
description: Herbert Rossoff finds himself spirited into the future once imagined by fellow writer Benny Russell! However, he cannot find his boss, Douglas Pabst, and fears the worst for him in this strange new future. Help Herbert wrap up this mystery.
rules:
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ferengi Traditionalists, Hirogen, Cardassian Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Bashir, Sloane, Quark, or T. Paris will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Bashir, Sloane, Quark, or T. Paris
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Janeway
featured_crew.flavor: Janeway and the away team blend into 20th century Los Angeles to pinpoint the location of Captain Braxton.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.flavor: Janeway and the away team blend into 20th century Los Angeles to pinpoint the location of Captain Braxton.

rewards.name: Rarity

adventures.description: Interview witnesses who were in the vicinity.

adventures.name: Traces of the Truth
adventures.description: Gather evidence to determine Pabst's fate.

rewards.name: One Incredible Tale
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Eyewitness Testimony
adventures.description: Interview witnesses who were in the vicinity.

adventures.name: Crime Scene Investigation
adventures.description: Scan the scene of Pabst's death.

adventures.name: Traces of the Truth
adventures.description: Gather evidence to determine Pabst's fate.

rewards.name: One Incredible Tale
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "This is... unbelievable. Never in a million years would I have thought those stories Benny was writing about the space station and all were real, but... here we are. If he could only see all this now. It all seemed so far-fetched."

"I'm just trying to take it all in. Hell, I wanna write it all down, my mind is just buzzing with possible stories, but--where's Doug? My boss, he was with me just now, when we were still in the Incredible Tales office."
"I mean, I guess maybe he didn't make the trip, but what fun would that be? Uh, I mean, that doesn't seem realistic to me. He was right next to me, and now he's gone."
"I don't know anyone here. This whole thing's a little over my head. But I might as well play along. You're a captain and you seem pretty savvy. Do you know of anyone who might be able to help me?"

"This is... unbelievable. Never in a million years would I have thought those stories Benny was writing about the space station and all were real, but... here we are. If he could only see all this now. It all seemed so far-fetched."

"I'm just trying to take it all in. Hell, I wanna write it all down, my mind is just buzzing with possible stories, but--where's Doug? My boss, he was with me just now, when we were still in the Incredible Tales office."
"I mean, I guess maybe he didn't make the trip, but what fun would that be? Uh, I mean, that doesn't seem realistic to me. He was right next to me, and now he's gone."
"I don't know anyone here. This whole thing's a little over my head. But I might as well play along. You're a captain and you seem pretty savvy. Do you know of anyone who might be able to help me?"
"Dead? Doug is dead...? I thought this outcome was possible...I just hoped it wouldn't actually come to pass. But you said these temporal anomalies pull people from different points in time, right?"

"If that's true, then that supports a theory of split timelines. That there are versions of Doug that can still live out their natural lives... I hope so, at least. Still, I owe it to this Doug to find out what happened."
"It is theoretically possible that he was torn apart by the physics of time-travel. But there's a community of us here, all brought by those temporal anomalies. So how come we made it and he didn't?"

responses.text: "This was no accident. This man was murdered."
"I'm with Paris. There's still much we don't know about the anomalies."
"Do I look like Dixon Hill to you? How should I know?"

screens.text: "But who would kill Doug? And why? Did someone else follow us from our time? Maybe an angry ex...? Maybe another time-traveller? What if Doug was wrapped up in some alien conspiracy?"
"Exactly. It seems the most plausible explanation to me, albeit a sad one."
"Dixon Hill? Now there's something I'm actually familiar with. My dad loved those novels. Still, you're more familiar with this time period and the temporal anomalies than any of us, Captain."
"This place is so unfamiliar to me, and Herbert, I'm sure you feel the same. I don't see any reason not to trust Mister Paris, but there's only one way to find out what really happened."
"Dead? Doug is dead...? I thought this outcome was possible...I just hoped it wouldn't actually come to pass. But you said these temporal anomalies pull people from different points in time, right?"

"If that's true, then that supports a theory of split timelines. That there are versions of Doug that can still live out their natural lives... I hope so, at least. Still, I owe it to this Doug to find out what happened."
"It is theoretically possible that he was torn apart by the physics of time-travel. But there's a community of us here, all brought by those temporal anomalies. So how come we made it and he didn't?"

responses.text: "This was no accident. This man was murdered."
"I'm with Paris. There's still much we don't know about the anomalies."
"Do I look like Dixon Hill to you? How should I know?"

"Dixon Hill? Now there's something I'm actually familiar with. My dad loved those novels. Still, you're more familiar with this time period and the temporal anomalies than any of us, Captain."
